benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from bundle

covered: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Multiple happy-path scenarios for removing all, one, or multiple custom fields (TC01–TC05, TC10, TC11, TC18, TC20, TC21).
DELETE Method - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when bundle not found, including empty DB state (TC07, TC23).
DELETE Method - Concurrency: Parallel deletes against the same bundle are exercised (TC16).
Input validation: Invalid bundleId format and truncated UUID handled with 400 (TC06, TC22); invalid customField UUID and empty value handled with 400 (TC09, TC19).
Required/optional headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC08); optional Reason/Comment accepted including boundary length for Comment (TC04, TC20, TC21).
Security/Authorization: 401 for invalid/expired token (TC13); injection attempt in headers is rejected safely (TC14).
Operational errors: 503 service unavailable and 504/503 on degraded dependency (TC12, TC24).
Behavioral integrity: Unrelated bundles unaffected (TC17); data consistency verified post-delete via GET (TC01–TC03, TC05, TC10, TC25).
Query parameter handling: Multi-valued customField parameter supported; extra unsupported parameter ignored without breaking behavior (TC03, TC11).
gaps: DELETE Method - Soft Deletes: No explicit verification of soft-delete vs hard-delete semantics (e.g., audit trail, deleted flag, ability to retrieve via admin/audit endpoints).
Idempotency: No scenario validating that repeating the same DELETE (after fields are already removed) returns a stable, expected response (e.g., 204 with no side effects).
Authorization vs Authentication: Only 401 covered; no 403 coverage for authenticated user lacking permission/role, if applicable.
Error response contract: Tests assert presence of an error message but do not verify response schema or Content-Type=application/json as specified; 204 responses do not assert empty body and headers.
Mixed validity in request: No case where some customField IDs are valid and present while others are invalid/not-on-bundle, to define expected outcome (partial success vs 400).
Header constraints completeness: Length/boundary tested for X-Killbill-Comment only; no limits/character set tests for X-Killbill-Reason or X-Killbill-CreatedBy beyond injection.
Rate/abuse and throttling: High-frequency DELETEs not covered (if applicable to operational limits), separate from functional concurrency.
recommendations: Add soft-delete/audit verification: After deletion, assert audit records exist and that fields are not just hidden; if soft-deleted, verify flags and admin/audit retrieval behavior.
Add idempotency test: Perform DELETE twice for the same set of customField IDs and expect consistent response (likely 204) with no errors.
Add authorization test: Authenticated user without required permission should receive 403 Forbidden (if the API enforces RBAC/tenant-level permissions).
Validate error contract and headers: Assert error body schema and Content-Type=application/json for 4xx/5xx; for 204, assert empty body and any expected headers.

Add mixed-list validation: Request with a mix of present, absent, and invalid customField IDs to confirm defined behavior (full failure 400 vs partial success with 207/204 and which fields are removed).
Extend header boundary tests: Include maximum length, disallowed characters, and Unicode for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Optional: Add rate/throttle scenario to observe 429 or service behavior under burst deletes, if relevant to SLOs/operational requirements.
